conclusion: Determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid flows downward and to the right from A, passing through the blue baffle.
Liquid from A eventually reaches the blue container (F).
Liquid flows downward and to the right from B, passing through the gray baffle.
Liquid from B eventually reaches the blue container (F).
Liquid flows downward and to the right from C, passing through the yellow baffle.
Liquid from C eventually reaches the blue container (F).
Liquid flows downward and to the right from D, passing through the green baffle.
Liquid from D eventually reaches the blue container (F).
Baffles are positioned to direct the flow of liquid downward and to the right.
All baffles guide the liquid towards the blue container (F).
Since all flow paths lead to the blue container (F), the liquid will flow into container F.
The liquid will flow into container F after passing through the baffles.
